com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter

Class TechnologyAdapterBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.processor.FIXMessageProcessorBase
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.processor.FIXSourceBase
            • com.camerontec.catalys.server.processor.FIXSourceListenerBase
              • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.TechnologyAdapterBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsTechnologyAdapter, IComponent, IEndOfDayPerformer, IExceptionListener, IFIXListener, IFIXMessageProcessor, IFIXSource, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, IMessageListener, IMessageProcessor, IMessageSource, ICatalysEventListener, Cloneable, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlatFileAdapter, JdbcAdapter

    public abstract class TechnologyAdapterBase
extends FIXSourceListenerBase
implements IsTechnologyAdapter
    Simple base class for technology adapter message processors.

    Messages from FIX are written to the peer application via a pluggable IPeerApplicationWriter in the SessionManager thread. Any necessary recovery in this direction is also performed in this thread.

    If the IMessageTransformer class supplied is also a IMessageProcessorEventTransformer then from FIX session management events (IFIXListener.onConnectionStatus(com.camerontec.catalys.util.messaging.MessageEvent, boolean), IFIXListener.onReset(com.camerontec.catalys.util.messaging.MessageEvent) and IExceptionListener.onException(com.camerontec.catalys.util.messaging.MessageEvent, java.lang.Exception)) messages are also transformed and written to the peer application when they occur.

    Messages are read from the peer application via a pluggable IPeerApplicationReader, which is used by an IControlledTask running in the thread of an ITaskController.

    The default IControlledTask implementation uses a polling mechanism to retrieve messages from the peer application. However, subclasses may specify their own reader task by overriding createPeerApplicationReaderTask(). The default controller supports configurable values for PEER_RECOVERY_INTERVAL and PEER_POLLING_INTERVAL which control its timing.

    Subclasses may choose to override the configuration of TRANSFORMER, PEER_WRITER and PEER_READER by providing custom implementations of createTransformer(), createPeerApplicationWriter() and createPeerApplicationReader() respectively.

    By default the ISharedFixSource model is not used when sending messages to FIX, however, subclasses may provide this by overriding getFixSource(com.camerontec.catalys.core.message.IFIXMessage).

    Both the IPeerApplicationWriter and IPeerApplicationReader interfaces are IComponents and this is used to control their state when errors are encountered. That is, when an error is encountered writing to a peer application the IPeerApplicationWriter is set inactive. The same applies when reading from a peer application. Recovery is then attempted on the next message (when writing to the peer application) or on the next poll (when reading from the peer application) by attempting to set the components' states to active. On failure the components' states are forced to inactive.

    Using the reader and writer components' active states in the above manner has the added advantage that their states are then visible via the command line (c_list) and any other monitoring mechanisms.

    By default each instance of this class creates and manages its own instance of a IPeerApplicationWriter and IPeerApplicationReader. However, technology adapters may share IPeerApplicationWriter and IPeerApplicationReader instances too. This is controlled by the specification (or not) of the PEER_APPLICATION_MANAGER_SERVICE attribute. If the manager service is specified (and configured as well) then it is used as the central point for all calls into the shared IPeerApplicationWriter and IPeerApplicationReader instances.

    This message processor base class sets the storeMessages attribute to false to enable message reuse.

      • AUTO_FORWARDING

        public static final String AUTO_FORWARDING
        The auto-forwarding attribute name. This is a boolean attribute and defaults to false.

        By default auto-forward should be off for technology adapters.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHECK_BEFORE_SEND

        public static final String CHECK_BEFORE_SEND
        The check before send attribute name. This is a boolean attribute and defaults to false.

        When this attribute is set to true messages received from the peer application are not sent via the the specified IFIXSource unless it has a logged on FIX session. The default value is false since the normal way to handle this condition is via an upstream source message buffer.

        Note that the default peer application reader task TechnologyAdapterBase.PolledPeerReaderTask assumes that if this flag is true then consecutive polls from the same peer application will return the same messages. That is, messages which are received from the peer application are not buffered if this flag is set to true but the messages cannot be sent. Therefore this feature is not applicable to all peer application types.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_CHECK_BEFORE_SEND

        public static final boolean DEFAULT_CHECK_BEFORE_SEND
        The default check before send value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • refreshStateFromAttributes

        public void refreshStateFromAttributes()
                                throws Exception
        Refreshes the state of this object from the values of its configured attributes. The PEER_RECOVERY_INTERVAL, PEER_POLLING_INTERVAL, AUTO_FORWARDING and CHECK_BEFORE_SEND attributes are refreshed. The attributes of the manager (which is either a PeerApplicationManager or a PeerApplicationManagerService) are also refreshed.
        Specified by:
        refreshStateFromAttributes in interface IHasAttributes
        Overrides:
        refreshStateFromAttributes in class FIXMessageProcessorBase
        Throws:
        Exception - If there is a problem performing the refresh.
